snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York founded the group with lofty aspirations, but progress has been stymied by politics and the logistical difficulties of coordinating action across dozens of cities.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's Cities United for Immigration Action, coalition of nation's mayors pushing for immigration reform, is off to slower start than expected; politics and logistical difficulties of coordinating action across dozens of cities have proved difficult, and coalition has been buffeted by court rulings that have stopped Pres Obama’s policies from taking effect.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York founded the group with lofty aspirations, but progress has been stymied by politics and the logistical difficulties of coordinating action across dozens of cities.

headline.main: Cities United, de Blasio’s Immigration Coalition, Has Big Goals but Modest Start
headline.print_headline: De Blasio’s Immigration Coalition Has Big Goals but a Modest Start
